title: Make BringIntoView work correctly with UI virtualization
body: BringIntoView does not work correctly with user interfaces that are virtualized. A great example is the TreeView. Calling BringIntoView on an item that is not currently on screen will not bring the item into view because it hasn't been drawn yet even though its model exists. The only way to get around this today is through hacks such as : http://lucisferre.net/2010/04/21/virtualizing-stack-panel-wpf-part-duex/

comments.body: I've found a more simple way using standard treeview and standard treeviewitem wit virtualization
